derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin intolerabilis, from in- 'not' + tolerabilis (see tolerable)

entry.tran: 不能忍受的;无法容忍的
entry.def: If you describe something as intolerable, you mean that it is so bad or extreme that no one can bear it or tolerate it.

example.ex: They felt this would put intolerable pressure on them...
example.tran: 他们觉得这会给他们带来无法承受的压力。

example.ex: Human rights abuses by any party are intolerable.
example.tran: 任何党派践踏人权的行为都不能容忍。

auth_sentence.content: "Such misuse of British passports is intolerable".
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Such misuse of British passports is intolerable".

auth_sentence.content: Tajiks and other ethnic minorities would find this intolerable.
auth_sentence.res_content: Tajiks and other ethnic minorities would find this intolerable.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Tajiks and other ethnic minorities would find this intolerable.

auth_sentence.content: Taylor says the crush at these border crossings was intolerable.

means.word_mean: 不能忍受的;无法容忍的

sentences.en: His illness placed an intolerable burden on his family.
sentences.cn: 他的病给家庭带来了无法承受的负担。
我觉得他的无礼令人无法容忍。
